title: Reflective Practice Workshop Based on Video Self-Analysis for Pre-Service Teachers

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental knowledge of classroom instruction management, mathematical subject matter knowledge, and foundational theories of teaching and learning
context.additional_context: Project-based course where pre-service teachers conduct self-assessment and peer feedback by analyzing real math lesson videos, including video recording and editing activities using digital devices (tablets, smartphones)

learning_goals: Preservice teachers can analyze their own math teaching videos to derive at least three specific improvement points linking instructional strategies to student responses
By comparing peer teachers' lesson videos, learners can identify at least two effective math teaching methods and apply them to their own instruction
Through reflective journals and video analysis reports, learners can systematically describe decision-making rationales in lesson design and implementation within 500 characters

resources: Digital Recording Devices for Classroom Use

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
